company.name: Razorpay
company.about: End-to-end payments and financial solutions for businesses in India: payment gateway, subscriptions, payouts (RazorpayX). Developer-friendly APIs, test sandbox, and enterprise offerings.

faq.a: Razorpay is a payments and financial solutions platform for businesses. It supports cards, UPI, netbanking, wallets, subscriptions and payouts through RazorpayX.

faq.q: How much does Razorpay charge per transaction?
faq.a: A commonly referenced platform fee is ~1.75% per transaction for standard plans; actual rates vary by instrument and account. GST and additional per-instrument charges may apply. Enterprise plans can have negotiated rates.

faq.q: Do you have a sandbox/test environment?
faq.a: Yes — Razorpay provides test API keys (rzp_test_*) so you can test integrations without real money.

faq.q: How do I switch between test and live modes?
faq.a: Use test API keys for development and the live keys (rzp_live_*) for production. Keep them separate to avoid processing real payments in testing.

faq.q: Is there a setup or maintenance fee?
faq.a: Standard gateway plans generally advertise no setup fee for small/standard accounts. Enterprise customers may have custom onboarding or maintenance fees negotiated.

faq.q: What about payouts and RazorpayX fees?
faq.a: RazorpayX payouts may have small fixed fees per payout plus taxes. Exact rates depend on payout type and volume—refer to RazorpayX billing for precise numbers.
Razorpay is for businesses of all sizes that need to accept payments online or automate payouts — from startups and SMBs to large enterprises.

faq.q: Can I accept recurring payments / subscriptions?
faq.a: Yes — Razorpay supports subscriptions via APIs and dashboard features for recurring billing management.
Integration speed depends on your stack. With developer-friendly APIs and SDKs, basic integration (checkout) can be done in hours; deeper integrations may take longer.

faq.q: Where can I find developer docs?
faq.a: Razorpay maintains public developer documentation and API references on their docs site (developer.razorpay.com).

pricing_notes.reference_platform_fee: ~1.75% (reference for standard gateway; GST may apply).
pricing_notes.note: Exact pricing varies by instrument (card, UPI, etc.) and account. Enterprise/custom plans require negotiation.
